A large portion of the Tyler settlement is known as the Blackacre Nature Preserve. This 170-acre tract is used by Jefferson County public schools as part of their environmental education.

The city of Jeffersontown is governed by a mayor and eight city council members. The mayor serves a four-year term of office while the council members serve two-year terms. The city council members are elected at-large
Kentucky: made up of the top eight candidates receiving the most votes in the general election. This system creates a bias toward candidates who can command a majority of the voters.
